intro: Psychotria tayabensis var. pinagteponanensis, commonly known as the Mindanao Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers, which are often fragrant. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
